text: [Music]
if the first Dark Souls depicted a world
gracefully drifting towards the
apocalypse Dark Souls 3 shows one on a
spiraling feverish descent directly into
it it's a Fierce and punishing Behemoth
of a game that dares you to take a step
forward before knocking you back
again and
again and again
and I always felt compelled to come back
eager for that familiar thrill of
overcoming even the most exacting
challenges Beyond a few disappointing
boss fights Dark Souls 3i's epic scale
aggressive obstacles and Rich lore make
it the grandest and fiercest Dark Souls
Adventure yet
[Music]
exploration is the Cornerstone of this
series and Dark Souls II does a lot to
reward an inquisitive and thorough
nature you could spend hours in a single
area diligently investigating every dark
corner or Side Road and be consistently
rewarded with some interesting story
Revelation new gear mini bosses and even
entire secret Areas the kingdom of
lothric and the lands that lie Beyond
also contain some of the most visually
striking places developer from software
has ever created even if many of them do
end up feeling like rehashes of familiar
locals its world isn't as largely
interconnected as that of Dark Souls I
but individual areas still weave their
own branching paths together seamlessly
creating twisting Mazes of overlapping
passages and shortcuts that were a joy
to lose myself in
the brutality of Dark Souls 3i's worlds
and the beasts that roam there are
matched only by its vicious new weapon
Arts which add variety and style to an
already strong combat system one moment
I'm crushing enemies with the
devastating weight of my great sword and
the next I'm turning the giant hunk of
curved steel into a graceful propeller
of Destruction some of the most awesome
looking weapon arts and one of the most
impressive strides in Dark Souls II's
combat in general enal come out of its
dual wielded weapon sets one great sword
and Dagger combo in particular lets you
perform several wide sweeping slashes
before delivering a final midair
blow you can also quickly lock onto new
enemies midchain prioritizing dangerous
or vulnerable individuals in a mob to
maximize the effect of your attacks
having access to this versatile arsenal
of Destruction is handy because Dark
Souls 3's roster of Relentless Horrors
hit harder and sometimes faster than
ever enemies are unusually crowded and
agile and AI Invaders fight with the
speed and aggression of a skilled pvper
this added a new but welcome layer of
challenge as well as some great
opportunities to make the most of my
weapon Arts I found myself approaching
combat situations with even more caution
and planning than Dark Souls usually
requires and I also kept several types
of weapons reinforced for dealing with
all manner of foe the Titanite used to
upgrade weapons is extremely plentiful
in Dark Souls I so no farming is
necessary to keep those handy options
ready Dark Souls I experiments a lot
more with the boss fight structure as
well boss fights have two phases now in
much the same way bloodborne does new
move sets and sometimes a brand new
health bar halfway through boss fights
kept the tension mounting and prevented
me from getting lazy with my
tactics some of these bosses have
well-placed weak spots that must be
targeted to deal damage while other
times they require a bit more puzzling
to take down those were always
interesting in concept but more often
than not resulted in fights that felt
underwhelming taking down a hulking
Giant in four hits is a waste of an
awesome boss design even if the method
is pretty cool dramatic frame rate dips
even on an ultra high-end PC also ruined
some otherwise fantastic looking fights
but overall the awe inspiring designs
moves music and lore implications make
dark souls 3i's boss battles incredibly
memorable and sometimes even surprising
[Music]
experiences if Dark Souls 3 truly is the
last in the series as we know it then
it's a worthy sendoff weapon Arts allow
stylish and versatile new moves without
tarnishing the purity of the combat
system lothric's awe inspiring locations
provide visually stunning arenas for
rigorous exploration and fierce faceoffs
with hosts of deadly enemies and even
deadlier bosses while not all the risky
changes land as neatly as others Dark
Souls 3 is a powerful journey and the
sequel the Dark Souls series truly
deserves for more on all things Dark
Souls stick with IGN
